method: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, combine ground beef, ground pork, breadcrumbs, milk, Parmesan cheese, onion, garlic, egg, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Form the mixture into a loaf shape and place it in a baking dish.
Wrap the loaf with bacon slices, overlapping slightly. Spread ketchup on top.
Bake for 1 hour or until the internal temperature reaches 160°F (70°C).
serve: Serve the bacon-wrapped meatloaf with mashed potatoes and gravy.

method: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a skillet, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat.
Add taco seasoning and water to the beef. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Spread tortilla chips on a large baking sheet. Top with seasoned beef and shredded cheddar cheese.
Bake in the oven for 10-15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from oven and top with sour cream, jalapeños, tomatoes, green onions, black olives, and guacamole.
serve: Serve the loaded nachos immediately with your favorite dipping sauces.

ingredients: 2 cups leftover macaroni and cheese, chilled
method: Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350°F (175°C).
Scoop chilled macaroni and cheese into balls and place on a baking sheet.
Coat each ball in flour, then dip in beaten eggs, and roll in a mixture of breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese.
Fry the balls in hot oil until golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes.
Drain on paper towels.
serve: Serve the deep-fried mac and cheese balls hot with ranch dressing for dipping.

method: Preheat grill or stover pan over medium-high heat.
Divide ground beef into 8 equal portions and form into patties. Season with salt and pepper.
Grill patties for 4-5 minutes per side or until desired doneness.
During the last minute of cooking, place a slice of cheddar and a slice of American cheese on 4 of the patties. Stack the other patties on top to form double burgers.
Toast burger buns on the grill until golden brown.
Assemble the burgers with mayonnaise, ketchup, mustard, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, and bacon.
serve: Serve the double cheeseburgers with fries and a cold soda.

method: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface and place on a pizza stone or baking sheet.
Spread Alfredo sauce evenly over the dough.
Top with shredded chicken, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, bacon, and green onions.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly.
serve: Serve the chicken Alfredo pizza hot with a side of garlic bread.
